resources.string: A mottle of defiance springs from some long-forgotten well.
%1$s avoids your attack, and bonks you on the head!
You succumb to injuries from %1$s! Game over!

string-array.name: enemies_easy
string-array.item: a small child of indeterminate sex
a teacup Chihuahua
a rolling bike wheel
an elderly woman using a walker
a baby with a full diaper

string-array.name: enemies_easy_description
string-array.item: It looks harmless. It probably is harmless. There is something wrong with one of its eyes, but you cannot discern what. It is advancing.
Its slightly aft grin is K-9 reminiscent, except for a small pulsation on its neck that is too regular to be a twitch. It is trotting determinedly toward you.
Physics should not account for the methodical beeline the wheel is making for you.
Grandma Pie Baker this is not. She\'s slow, she\'s frail, and she\'s not getting out of your way.
It\'s just sitting in front of you. A stinking, whining, inconsolable mess.

string-array.name: job_events_bad
string-array.item: Your boss hates you and lets you know it. Loudly.
Todd from Accounting pees in your coffee again.
The office receptionist forgets your name. You\'ve both worked there for 32 years.
One of your clients is unhappy. He\'s a wolf, and you\'re the fattest one there.
Your paycheck is missing a few zeros, and it only had a few to begin with.
Your work socks have dissolved.
Today\'s lunch break has been replaced with nothing.
Your last cigarette tasted like a camel. The animal, not the brand.
The cute one in Accounts Billable wrote you another letter proclaiming their disdain.
You slip on the floor and take a bite of the floor.
One of your shoes leaves the office.
The ducks in your office building\'s courtyard reject your bread.
Your favorite song is on the radio and you don\'t have a radio.
Your laptop is on fire.
Your desk is on fire.
Your hair is on fire.
You\'ve been demoted. You find out from a Snapple bottle cap.
The whole office got together and built a life-sized effigy of you to throw things at.
Your salary has been inversely tied to inflation.
You are assigned the role of foot stool at the next office party.
Your last zoom meeting ended in vomiting.
Your latest client has decided that they are not your client.
The water cooler refuses to dispense to you.
Lunch consisted of sadness with a side of nothing.
Your boss needs to you stay after the office closes and catch ghouls.

string-array.name: job_events_good
string-array.item: You\'ve been promoted! One step forward, five steps back, as they say.
Your boss didn\'t spit in your face this morning.
No one at the office has asked you to be their slap toy today.
You find two pennies in the office courtyard fountain.
You find an old shoe in the office bathroom. It kind of fits.
Your office laptop has taken a break from flashing you with strobe lights.
Friday\'s death match against Sven the Destroyer from IT has been cancelled.
This week\'s Casual Friday will not begin with a dressing down of you.
Janice from Public Relations is out of town and will not be hunting you for sport this week.
You caught two ghouls last night and your boss has rewarded you with a lettuce bounty.

string-array.name: finance_events_bad
string-array.item: You\'ve fallen for another deposed prince scam.
The IRS has attached a funnel to your money bag.
Tuition for your kids has increased because the school hates you. Not your kids, but you.
Your significant other\'s dollar snacking habit has accelerated
Money grows on trees and you\'re in Qatar (they have no trees).
Your dog needs a new head.
Your dog needs a new butt.
Your dog needs a new tail.
Your eldest child has accelerated his training for Nathan\'s Hot Dog Eating Contest, and insists you buy only the choicest cuts of beef
Your health insurer has added an ugly duckling surcharge on a sliding scale and you have broken the scale
You win a sunken boat on The Price is Right and have to pay taxes on it.
You win the California State Reverse Lottery and owe the jackpot.
Your dog has given birth to duodecaplets and they all have expensive diseases.
The neighborhood cat is blackmailing you.
You catch your neighbor cheating on his wife and he\'s somehow blackmailing you.
The Hamburglar is upset at your lack of hams, and takes money instead.
Subway is no longer honoring your free sandwich cards. Just yours.
The local recycling center now requires items to be doofus-free.
Your dollar-bill phobia is starting to catch up to you.
Your custom medical-grade deodorant has doubled in price.
You get a speeding ticket while sitting on your porch.
Walmart decides to sue you again.
The police are demanding more bribes to protect you from yourself.
Your collection of newspaper hats has declined in value.
China has decided it will no longer prop you up economically.
You are required by a court to pay alimony. You are still married.

string-array.name: finance_events_good
string-array.item: You bet against yourself in a beauty contest and win.
One of your deposed prince scammers feels guilty and return a bit of the money.
You are mistaken by aid workers for a charity case.
You find a quarter in your youngest child\'s ear. Are there more?
Your Roth IRA has synergized the actuated backward overflow of depreciated commercial assets.
The bank teller is about to quit and commit seppuku, and decides to give you extra money.
Your significant other decides to put the whole family on an oxygen-only cleanse, which is pretty cheap.
The ringing in your ears turns out to be just a bunch of silver dollars.
Someone lands on Boardwalk and you don\'t have it mortgaged.
Your car returns home and forgives you.

string-array.name: family_events_bad
string-array.item: Your significant other hates you. That\'s it. That\'s the whole thing.
Your significant other reminds you that this is a green card arrangement.
Your significant other leaves you poisoned hot dogs for dinner.
Your youngest child deflates your car tires in front of you. You are helpless to stop it.
Your eldest child introduces you to their date as \"that creepy old neighbor\".
Your children declare they are on strike until you are less ugly.
The mail now includes love letters that are not for you.
Your new couples therapist has declared you an albatross.
The family dog has declared for your significant other.
The neighborhood cat has declared for your significant other.
The neighborhood shrew has declared for your significant other.
Your significant other has ordered \"The Marriage Defuser\" from QVC.
A baby has arrived at your doorstep. It declares you a bad parent and leaves.
Your mother-in-law has declared you an enemy of the state.
Your father-in-law has declared you an enemy of the state.
Your brother-in-law has declared you an enemy of the state.
Everyone was invited to the family reunion except you. Literally everyone. In the world.
Your fifth cousin is no longer the kissing cousin.
Your parents tell you that adoption records are a cruel joke.
Your parents replace you in their family photos with Macaulay Culkin
You receive a Google alert about another life insurance policy opened in your name.
Your significant other has decided to get your name tattooed on the leg she uses for life mistakes.
You arrive home to discover the same state of dismal, quiet desperation as when you left.
Your middle child takes a picture of Ted Lasso to \"Take Your Father to Work Day\"
Your family has decided there is no room in the house for you tonight.
Your birth parents have decided to let you visit home, provided you wear a mask.

string-array.name: family_events_good
string-array.item: You find the birthday card you bought for yourself when your family forgot. It still smells like whiskey.
Your family has decided to suspend the daily \"Two Minutes of Hate\" directed at you.
Your youngest child had stopped asking you to hide in the closet when her friends come over.
Your couples therapist no longer feels you\'re 105 percent to blame.
The family dog has decided to let you make eye contact again.
The neighborhood cat has stopped using you as a scratching post. For now.
Your significant other has stopped comparing you unfavorably to their side bae.
Another state has deemed you human and now recognizes your marriage.
Your mother-in-law has stopped sending you hourly hate mail. For now.
Your father-in-law has stopped burning effigies of you on Facebook Live. For now.

string-array.name: social_life_bad
string-array.item: Still no friend requests on Facebook. Do people still use Facebook?
One of your last twitter followers has unfollowed, citing irreconcilable differences.
Your old MySpace page has been sold to a Russian circus.
Instagram no longer allows you to post selfies, citing public health concerns.
TikTok has reduced the length of your videos to 0 seconds.
Your high school reunion has sent you a "Not Invited" invitation.
Your grade school crush still hates you. Still.
Your old college bae has been arrested for being a goat.
Your best invisible friend has decided that things are not working out.
The stranger whom you donated a kidney to is trying to give it back.
The love letter you sent into space has been returned. On fire.
Your best non-invisible friend turns out to be invisible.
The city has decided you need to be quarantined for a month. Just because.
The local pet shelter is trying to hire you to show the animals that \'things could be worse\."
You are known as \"Moses\" at the local watering hole because people just part for you.
Your local Wednesday night Bingo club informs you that your personality needs an overhaul.
Strippers have begun throwing dollars at you. Silver dollars. At your head.
Your significant other\'s side bae no longer wants to be friends.
Your local church has started replacing \"Hell\" with \"Locked in a room with you\."
The talent at a weekly comedy show decides to abandon their sets and just heckle you for 2 hours.
Goodwill rejects your clothes, citing crimes against humanity.
The \"Big Sibling\" program has decided to close down and euthanize its clients after meeting you.
The Starbucks barista writes \"God Has Forsaken Me\" on your drink.
You have no friends. That\'s it.
Parking Enforcement has ticketed your car as being \"abandoned\" with you in it.

string-array.name: social_life_good
string-array.item: Your grade school dog has come back to life, "\Pet Semetary\" style, and you have a pleasant evening cannibalising with them.
The Starbucks barista allows you to make eye contact.
You are accepted by a cult of cult addicts, and it\'s not terrible.
Your eldest child\'s friends decide to stop bullying you for a day, and let you sniff glue with them.
You go fishing with colleagues and they do not force you to be the bait.
You have been unbanned from social media outlets, citing the new federal policy against animal cruelty
You rack up a high score on Skee-Ball at the local bar and for a moment, everyone doesn\'t hate you.
Your knee-jerk plan at faking a deadly illness for sympathy works.
You get mail addressed to \"Local Resident,"\, and you know you are loved.
The local church allows you to attend services again, if only to make up for latest molestation scandal.
